overview_of_class: Literary traditions evolving from Latin American conceptions of regional and indigenous cultures in the 19th and 20th centuries. Authors such as José María Arguedas, Miguel Ángel Asturias, Rosario Castellanos, Rómulo Gallegos, José Hernández, José Carlos Mariátegui, Clorinda Matteo de Turner, and José Eustasio Rivera.
name: Region and Rootedness Latin America
title: WCAS SPANISH 342-0-1 Region and Rootedness Latin America

descriptions.name: Overview of class
